articles.title: Bitcoin's boom challenges anyone who believes the market is an efficient judge of value
articles.author: Ian McGugan
articles.summary: There's been a boom in the value of crypto over the past year. Promoters are looking for a new wave of 'stablecoins' - digital tokens that tie their value to an underlying asset, such as the U.S. dollar or gold. President Donald Trump and a bipartisan swath of Congress have suddenly turned into crypto boosters. They're demolishing restrictions on crypto use and pushing forward projects.

articles.title: PCC to discuss crypto regulations on June 2
articles.author: Irshad Ansari
articles.summary: The Pakistan Crypto Council (PCC) will hold an important meeting on June 2 to consider regulations and legal framework related to the broader scenario for digital and crypto currencies in Pakistan. Federal Finance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb will chair the meeting. It will be attended by PCC chief Bilal Bin Saqib, SBP governor, SECP chairman, and secretaries of law and information technology ministries. The key agenda items of the meeting include development of a robust regulatory framework for digital assets in Pakistan and establishment of the Pakistan Virtual Assets Regulatory Authority.

articles.title: Trump Media Closes Bitcoin Treasury Deal  May. 30, 2025 23:24
articles.summary: Trump Media and Technology Group Corp. has closed its previously announced private placement offering with approximately 50 institutional investors. Trump Media will use the approximately $2.32 billion in net proceeds from the Offering to create a Bitcoin treasury and for general corporate purposes and working capital. It is one of the largest Bitcoin treasury deals for any public company.

articles.title: Trump's Oval Office Farewell to Musk
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Elon Musk has left Washington D.C. and received an Oval Office farewell from Donald Trump. His departure raises questions about his relationship with Washington and the potential ramifications for his various ventures, including the cryptocurrency Dogecoin. The relationship between tech leaders and Washington is multifaceted, marked by collaboration, regulation, and tension.

articles.title: $TRUMP and other meme coins won't be protected by SEC, Commissioner Hester Peirce says
articles.author: MacKenzie Sigalos
articles.summary: The SEC doesn't regulate meme coins, so investors shouldn't expect any guidance on $ Trump's coin. Since President Trump took office in January, the SEC has been rolling back its enforcement in crypto. It's a controversial strategy as the president and his family deepen their involvement in crypto, profiting from it.

articles.title: Stablecoins stole the show at Bitcoin 2025 — here's what the major players said
articles.author: MacKenzie Sigalos
articles.summary: Stablecoins, the dollar-pegged digital tokens, are driving a full-scale financial and political shift in Washington. The momentum behind stablecoin legislation and crypto market reform is accelerating. Vice President JD Vance is the first sitting U.S. vice president to address the bitcoin community at Bitcoin 2025 in Las Vegas. The GENIUS Act, a Senate bill that would establish the first comprehensive regulatory framework for stablecoin issuers, is expected to be passed on Monday. House Republicans are racing to match that pace.

articles.title: Ross Ulbricht: Keeping Someone Like Me In A Cage Until I Died Was A Threat To Freedom Itself

articles.title: Elon Musk put a spotlight on federal spending, but cut less than he wanted
articles.author: Thomas Beaumont
articles.summary: Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) is expected to fall short of its goals to cut government spending by $150 billion. The current results are well short of Bill Clinton's initiative to streamline the federal bureaucracy, which saved the equivalent of $240 billion by the end of Clinton's second term. Experts blame a lack of expertise in technology and lack of time to prepare the team.

The ceremony was an attempt at damage control following Musk's criticisms of Trump's 'One Big, Beautiful Bill' which would more than double the national deficit.

Will Cole, her son-in-law, is also a Bitcoin maximalist like her. He frequently criticizes Ripple, underlined a popular crypto account on X called CowboyCrypto. Cole has been sharing Catholic Bitcoin CEO Pierre Rochard's posts criticizing Ripple for its alleged anti-Bitcoin and pro-CBDC stances.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's North Korea Infiltrates US Remote Jobs With The Help Of Everyday Americans, Funneling $17 Million Through 'Laptop Farm' Run By Unwitting TikToker: Report
articles.author: Proiti Seal Acharya
articles.summary: Kim Jong Un's North Korea is secretly infiltrating American businesses via remote jobs. Christina Chapman's Minnesota home functioned as a hub for foreign operatives posing as American IT workers. They secured jobs at more than 300 American companies, collecting $17.1 million in pay. Chapman handled paperwork, assisted with job applications and forwarded pay after taking a cut. She shipped almost 50 devices abroad and helped create false tax records for more than 35 people. The FBI raided her home in October 2023 and seized more than 90 devices. She pleaded guilty to several federal charges including identity theft and money laundering. She earned around $177,000 from the operation and now faces over nine years in prison.

articles.title: Second suspect in Manhattan crypto kidnapping and torture case indicted
articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.summary: William Duplessie has been indicted in the kidnapping and torture of an Italian man for his Bitcoin. The indictment will remain sealed until his arraignment on June 11. He is accused of kidnapping, assault, unlawful imprisonment, and criminal possession of a weapon with John Woeltz, 37. The victim, 28, says he was held captive for 17 days in Manhattan's Soho neighborhood. Two NYPD detectives who worked at the townhouse where the man was held are also being investigated.

articles.title: Trump honours Musk with golden key despite resignation
articles.author: Tara
articles.summary: President Donald Trump presented Elon Musk with a ceremonial golden key to the White House on Friday. The gesture came just a day after Musk confirmed his resignation from the Department of Government Efficiency (Doge), a temporary agency created to cut costs and reduce federal bureaucracy. Musk had served as the face of Doge since its formation earlier this year, leading an aggressive campaign to shrink the federal workforce. The agency cut approximately 260,000 civilian jobs, or about 12 percent of the federal headcount, primarily through layoffs and buyouts. Musk's relationships within the administration have cooled, particularly over recent policy disagreements. Musk criticised Trump's flagship tax legislation earlier this week.
